Node.definition: = a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Berechiah (בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► temple singer; time of king David (דָּוִד)
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions

Node.gloss: to keep quiet|to keep still|to rest
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities refrain from acting
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea
= person who experiences hostily towards someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to raise one's head|to raise one's horn
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (one's) head/horn; hence: = action by which nations make an effort to engage in a military conflict with others, usually after having been defeated before but not totally

literally: to lift up (one's) head; hence: = action by which nations still have the ability to engage themselves in a military conflict with others, ◄ as someone who can still lift up his head after having been beaten down
= to devise a plan with the quality mentioned under [a]
= a decision or advice of a group of persons, often secret and sometimes harmful to another
= action by which humans come together to exercise their minds as a group to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
literally: stored up in a safe place, hence: = person or object considered valuable and/or treated with affection

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= causitive action or process by which humans or deities forcibly terminate the existence of an individual or group of people

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans come together to exercise their minds as a group to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= people living in a certain home or larger area, usually with a common ancestor
= nation; ◄ considered descendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= person regarded as descendant of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם)
= a nation and its territory; ◄ situated E. of Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) regarded as founded by a son of Lot (לֹוט)
= member of ethnic group living east of Gilead (גִּלְעָד) ◄ possibly regarded as descendants of Hagar (הָגָר) ► conquered by Saul (שָׁאוּל)
= ethnic group or nation, probably to be identified with the Arabic clan Jibal; ◄ located in Transjordan, probably southeast of Dead Sea, near Petra
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)
= ethnic group living a nomadic existence; ◄ regarded as decendants of Esau (עֵשָׂו) ► regarded as mortal enemies of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ultimately destroyed by Saul (שָׁאוּל)

= land of the Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי) situated along the coast of the Meditteranean and concentrated around the cities of Gaza (עַזָּה) Gath (גַּת) Ekron (עֶקְרֹון) Ashdod (אַשְׁדֹּוד) and Ashkelon (אַשְׁקְלֹון)
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= town; ◄ on the Phoenician coast; ► famous as sea port

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= action by which humans associate themselves with another human, a group of people, or a deity for a particular purpose
literally: arm; hence: = the ability to exert strength
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Haran (הָרָן) ► nephew of Abram (אַבְרָם) who settled in Sodom (סְדֹם) and was later rescued by angels; regarded as ancestor of Moab (מֹואָב) and Ammon (עַמֹּון)

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= man; ◄ son of Midian (מִדְיָן) son of Keturah (קְטוּרָה) wife of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name
= man; ► army commander of Jabin (יָבִין) king of Hazor (חָצֹור)
= man; ► king of Hazor (חָצֹור) time of Deborah (דְּבֹורָה)
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

= river; ◄ that drains the western portion of the Plain of Esdraelon from Megiddo (מְגִדֹּו) to the sea, fed by springs from Gilboa (גִּלְבֹּעַ) and the foot of the Carmel (כַּרְמֶל) range; ► location where Sisera (סִיסְרָא) was defeated and where Elijah (אֵלִיָּהוּ) killed the prophets of Baal (בַּעַל)

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= town; ◄ territory of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= excrement; ◄ produced by animals; ► source of pollution and impurity; ≈ regarded as filthy and only good as fertilizer

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= man; ◄ chief of Midianites (מִדְיָנִי) defeated and killed by Gideon (גִּדְעֹון)
= man; ► a chief of the Midianites (מִדְיָנִי) defeated and killed by Gideon (גִּדְעֹון)
= man; ► king of Midian during time of Gideon
= man; ► king of Midian during time of Gideon
= person in a position of authority over a nation or tribe
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= any of several plants that commonly break from their roots at maturity and, drying into a rounded tangle of light, stiff branches, roll before the wind, covering long distances and scattering seed as they go; ≈ associated with things that lack weight and substance and do not endure

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which someone causes something else to be harmed or destroyed by fire
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

= action by which humans, divine beings, or certain events cause (other) humans to experience a state of great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such as trembling and pain
literally: to fill (someone's) face with shame; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to be deeply ashamed in such a way that it shows on their faces
= state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

= action by which humans, divine beings, or certain events cause (other) humans to experience a state of great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such as trembling and pain
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= an adverb that specifies unending time
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events
= an epithet for the God of Israel ◄ as the one who not only lives in the highest heavens but is also worthy of the highest honor

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
